A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
For me\, this was beyond disappointing to the levels I felt when I watched the phantom menace.
The whole thing seemed like a poorly constructed story with forced humour which seemed to miss the spot for me. The direction looked like he really wanted to direct an 80's kung fu movie\, which in part it seemed to parody. The cast were strong as usual\, particularly Adam Driver.
The most mysterious characters from TFA became easily discarded and discredited and were portrayed in a pantomime style. Much of the dialogue was clunky and the whole plot essentially a monkey-island style side quest during a "slow dipping mechanism" which made little sense.
Occasionally something in the movie shined such as some of Luke's speeches and revelations about the force.
Much like the phantom menace there was a good movie in there somewhere but I couldn't find it as I was too busy cringing at every piece of poor humour or slapstick gag.
Visually impressive for the most part but when the grand enemy ensconced on their throne makes you think of a Robert Palmer video from the 80's...it's not going well.
After the decent fun of TFA and the great story telling of Rogue one\, this was just such a disappointment.
